p: 24. The formal meaning of “phenomenology.” In formal terms, “phenomenology” as the title of a branch of philosophical work is composed, as we saw, of two words: logos and phainomenon (plural: phainomena). In a general and formal sense, “phenomenology” means legein ta phainomena, making sense of what appears by drawing that sense from the thing itself rather than from how we feel about the thing. In this formal sense, phenomenology embodies the maxim we noted above: Stay directly focused on what you experience in terms of how you experience it.
